Name: Seated Statue of a High Official
Description: This painted statue depicts a man seated on a block seat with his feet resting on the base. His facial features are typical of statues of the Old Kingdom. The eyes are painted and the eyelids are decorated with green malachite. His wig leaves his ears free. He wears a short kilt pleated on one side with a dagger fixed in the belt. The belt buckle has flat decorations. He holds an emblem symbolizing his dignity in his right hand, while his left hand is open on his lap. The proportions of his feet do not match those of his body.
